title: Akron Beacon Journal - Wikipedia
snippet: The paper was founded with the 1897 merger of the Summit Beacon, first published in 1839, and the Akron Evening Journal, founded in 1896. In 1903, the Beacon Journal was purchased by Charles Landon Knight. His son John S. Knight inherited the paper, in 1933, on Charles' death.

title: Akron Beacon Journal sold to GateHouse Media
snippet: The Akron paper was owned by the Knight family for nearly seven decades starting in 1907, and then the Knight Ridder company beginning in 1974. That company sold the Beacon Journal to McClatchy Co.

title: Akron Beacon Journal Sold to GateHouse Media, Owner of Columbus Dispatch, Canton Repository
snippet: The Akron Beacon Journal has been sold to Gatehouse Media, the largest publisher of daily newspapers in the United States and the owner of the Columbus Dispatch, the Canton Repository and a preponderance of smaller-town dailies.
